indicators.name: icu_admission
indicators.description: Patient is admitted to the Intensive Care Unit

indicators.name: risk_for_pseudomonas
indicators.description: Patient has risk factors for Pseudomonas infection

indicators.name: bronchiectasis
indicators.description: Presence of bronchiectasis or structural lung disease

indicators.name: recent_broad_spectrum_antibiotics
indicators.description: Broad-spectrum antibiotics > 7 days in past month

indicators.name: nursing_home_resident
indicators.description: Admitted from or resided in nursing facility in past 3 months

indicators.name: immunocompromised
indicators.description: Immunocompromised due to conditions or medications

indicators.name: s_pneumoniae_pcn_susceptible
indicators.description: S. pneumoniae isolate susceptible to penicillin

indicators.name: s_pneumoniae_pcn_intermediate
indicators.description: S. pneumoniae isolate intermediate to penicillin

indicators.name: s_pneumoniae_pcn_resistant
indicators.description: S. pneumoniae isolate resistant to penicillin

indicators.name: s_pneumoniae_cephalosporin_susceptible
indicators.description: S. pneumoniae isolate susceptible to cephalosporins

indicators.name: h_influenzae_ampicillin_susceptible
indicators.description: H. influenzae isolate susceptible to ampicillin

indicators.name: h_influenzae_ampicillin_resistant
indicators.description: H. influenzae isolate resistant to ampicillin (beta-lactamase producing)

indicators.name: culture_and_antigen_negative
indicators.description: Both culture and urine antigen tests negative

decision_tree.node: Diagnosis of CAP requires symptoms plus oxygen need and radiographic infiltrates

branches.condition: (cough OR shortness_of_breath OR pleuritic_chest_pain) AND oxygen_requirement AND radiographic_infiltrates
branches.name: Confirmed CAP

branches.condition: risk_for_pseudomonas OR bronchiectasis OR recent_broad_spectrum_antibiotics OR recent_prolonged_hospitalization OR nursing_home_resident OR recent_mechanical_ventilation OR immunocompromised
branches.name: ICU patient with pseudomonas risk

branches.condition: NOT (risk_for_pseudomonas OR bronchiectasis OR recent_broad_spectrum_antibiotics OR recent_prolonged_hospitalization OR nursing_home_resident OR recent_mechanical_ventilation OR immunocompromised)
branches.name: ICU patient without pseudomonas risk
No severe PCN allergy
branches.decision: Ceftriaxone 1 g IV Q24H PLUS Azithromycin 500 mg IV Q24H

branches.name: No severe PCN allergy
branches.decision: Ampicillin/sulbactam 1.5 g IV Q6H PLUS (Azithromycin 500 mg daily OR Doxycycline 100 mg BID) OR Ceftriaxone 1 g IV Q24H PLUS (Azithromycin 500 mg daily OR Doxycycline 100 mg BID) OR Cefdinir 300 mg PO Q12H PLUS (Azithromycin 500 mg daily OR Doxycycline 100 mg BID)

branches.name: Necrotizing pneumonia with cavitation and influenza-like illness
branches.decision: Add Linezolid 600 mg IV/PO Q12H to regimen while awaiting cultures; consult ID

branches.name: Severe PCN allergy
branches.decision: Azithromycin (specific regimen) OR Moxifloxacin if Erythromycin resistant

branches.name: No PCN allergy
branches.decision: Penicillin G 1.5 million units IV Q6H OR Amoxicillin 500 mg PO Q8H

branches.name: S. pneumoniae PCN intermediate or urine antigen positive
branches.decision: Penicillin G 1.5 million units IV Q6H OR Amoxicillin 1 g PO Q8H (adjust for allergy as per PCN susceptible)

branches.name: S. pneumoniae PCN resistant, cephalosporin susceptible
branches.decision: Ceftriaxone 1 g IV Q24H OR Cefdinir 300 mg PO Q12H; if PCN allergy use Moxifloxacin

branches.name: H. influenzae ampicillin susceptible
branches.decision: Ampicillin 1 g IV Q6H OR Amoxicillin 500 mg PO Q8H; adjust for allergy (Azithromycin, Cefdinir, Doxycycline, or Moxifloxacin)

branches.name: H. influenzae ampicillin resistant
branches.decision: Ampicillin/sulbactam 1.5 g Q6H OR Amoxicillin/clavulanate 875 mg PO Q12H; adjust for allergy (Azithromycin, Cefdinir, Doxycycline, or Moxifloxacin)

branches.name: Legionella infection
branches.decision: Azithromycin 500 mg IV/PO Q24H OR Moxifloxacin 400 mg IV/PO Q24H (adjust duration for PCN allergy)

branches.name: Culture and antigen negative
branches.decision: Cefdinir 300 mg PO BID OR Amoxicillin/clavulanate XR 2 g PO Q12H; if PCN allergy use Moxifloxacin
